page.title: 16A Traffic Survey
page.content: One Tuesday afternoon, early in the Summer Term, our class did a 1/2 hour count of vehicles passing the school on the Keighley-Kendal trunk road. In that time 133 vehicles had passed in the direction of Settle, of which the majority (105) were cars. 154 vehicles went past going towards Skipton. Again cars (112) were the majority, with wagons(35) coming second. We calculated that if these figures were typical, it would mean approximately 4,600 vehicles going through the village in an eight hour day. Most of the cars we saw were either blue, white or red. We counted how many people were in each car that passed, and noticed that approximately 1/2 had two occupants, 1/3 had only one,1/6 had more than 2.
